name: Menzies Glasgow Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at the Menzies recently on business as my usual hotel was fully booked and I must say I was pleasantly surprised. From the outside I had never quite fancied it as it reminds me somewhat of an army barracks but upon my most recent stay I have to say the standards are quite high. Very good rooms with nice big comfy bed with too many pillows and cushions to count. All the usual features within the hotel, nice bar and restaurant, breakfast was ok although I had to wait until i'd finished my breakfast before they remembered my pot of tea, not a major issue in a busy breakfast room. Very handy for city centre and the exhibition centre close by so all in all a decent option for a city centre hotel.
reviews.title: Very decent option for a glasgow stay

FINE, BUT WITH A FEW EXCEPTIONS
reviews.text: Stayed here for a week with a coach party. Location good for the coach, but a bit out of the city if you are on your own. The rooms are fine, well appointed and quite large. Leisure centre is also very good and well kept. Breakfast wa excellent with a wide choice. Dinner was the worst aspect, we were on a restricted menu which was very boring and of generally poor quality. The wider menu did look much better. The staff are varied, all were pleasant and friendly but the organisation seemed lacking.

reviews.title: Dicey location, dated room
reviews.text: Bar service was also poor, beer keg took long time to replace.

reviews.title: Excellent business hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is listed as four stars, but it is in a dicey location -- an industrial area near the river. It did not feel like it would be safe to walk from it to other locations. The rdom I had d was fairly spacious, but the furnishings were rather dated. The desk and dresser was under-sized and not comfortable for sitting at with a laptop. The bathroom was also dated. The public rooms look better.

reviews.title: Relaxing stay, welcoming staff and excellent lesiure facilities
reviews.text: I stay here a lot as my home office is quite close by, and it is perfect for me, very close (5 minute walk) to the city centre, it has an excellent restaurant, with a very good breakfast in the morning.

The hotel was nice, the food was good, and I slept well, but this hotel is too far from everything. It seemed like a mile to walk to a store, and then I got lost coming back and ended up under a bridge in a creepy place. I quickly turned and found the entrance. In the 17 days I was in the UK, this was the most creepy I felt, and I was going in and out of pubs down alleys in London, multiple towns in Scotland, and in Edinburgh.
reviews.title: The hotel is far from everything.

description: A few minutes walk from Glasgow Central Station this AA 4 star hotel offers quiet, spacious, air-conditioned rooms with free wi-fi, Sky Sports 1,2,3 and F1 in our rooms,leisure facilities and on-site parking. The "Waves" health and leisure club offers a 15 metre pool, steam room and fully equipped gymnasium. The Savannah Spa also offers 3 treatment rooms. Our bedrooms are quiet, spacious, modern, yet traditional and offer free Wi-Fi, 32 inch flat screen TVs with Freeview, ironing facilities, bathrobes, mini fridges, hairdryer and tea & coffee making facilities. The hotel has been accredited with a Silver award from Green Business Tourism. George Street, Argyll Arcade and the St Enoch Centre are all within a 10 minute walk, the SECC is a 15 minute walk and Scotland’s National Stadium at Hampden is 5 minutes away by car. Car parking is available at the hotel at a small cost.
